CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION longestPalindrome(s)
        SET length AS THE COUNT OF s
        SET truth_matrix AS AN ARRAY (length) OF ARRAYS (length) FILLED WITH TRUE
        SET start_index AS 0
        SET max_length AS 1
        
        SET outer_index AS length MINUS 2
        WHILE outer_index IS GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO 0 DO
            SET inner_index AS outer_index PLUS 1
            WHILE inner_index IS LESS THAN length DO
                SET truth_matrix[outer_index][inner_index] AS FALSE
                
                IF NOT (s[outer_index] NOT EQUAL TO s[inner_index]) THEN
                    SET truth_matrix[outer_index][inner_index] AS truth_matrix[outer_index PLUS 1][inner_index MINUS 1]
                    
                    IF truth_matrix[outer_index][inner_index] IS TRUE THEN
                        IF (max_length LESS THAN (inner_index MINUS outer_index PLUS 1)) THEN
                            SET start_index AS outer_index
                            SET max_length AS (inner_index MINUS outer_index PLUS 1)
                        END IF
                    END IF
                END IF
                INCREMENT inner_index BY 1
            END WHILE
            DECREMENT outer_index BY 1
        END WHILE
        
        RETURN s SUBSTRING FROM start_index TO (start_index PLUS max_length MINUS 1)
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION longestPalindrome(s)  
        SET n TO the LENGTH OF s  
        SET f TO a TWO DIMENSIONAL LIST of BOOLEAN TRUES with n ROWS and n COLUMNS  
        SET k TO zero  
        SET mx TO one  
        FOR i FROM n MINUS two DOWN TO zero  
            FOR j FROM i PLUS one TO n MINUS one  
                SET element at position i and position j of f TO FALSE  
                IF element at position i of s EQUALS element at position j of s  
                    SET element at position i and position j of f TO element at position i PLUS one and position j MINUS one of f  
                    IF element at position i and position j of f EQUALS TRUE AND mx LESS THAN j MINUS i PLUS one  
                        SET k TO i  
                        SET mx TO j MINUS i PLUS one  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        RETURN substring from position k TO position k PLUS mx MINUS one of s  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION myAtoi(s)  
        SET maxIntValue AS (2 ^ 31) - 1  
        SET minIntValue AS 0 - (2 ^ 31)  
        SET accumulatedNumber TO 0  
        SET position TO 0  
        SET lengthOfString TO LENGTH OF s  
        SET polarity TO 1  

        WHILE position < lengthOfString AND s[position] = ' '  
            position ← position + 1  
        END WHILE  

        IF position < lengthOfString THEN  
            SWITCH s[position]  
                CASE '-'  
                    polarity ← 0 - 1  
                    position ← position + 1  
                    BREAK  
                CASE '+'  
                    polarity ← 1  
                    position ← position + 1  
                    BREAK  
            END SWITCH  
        END IF  

        REPEAT UNTIL NOT (position < lengthOfString AND s[position] >= '0' AND s[position] <= '9')  
            SET currentChar TO s[position]  
            SET numericValue TO INTEGER VALUE OF currentChar  
            SET boundaryCheck TO maxIntValue - (numericValue DIV 10)  

            IF accumulatedNumber > boundaryCheck THEN  
                IF polarity = 1 THEN  
                    RETURN maxIntValue  
                ELSE  
                    RETURN minIntValue  
                END IF  
            END IF  

            accumulatedNumber ← (accumulatedNumber * 10) + numericValue  
            position ← position + 1  
        END REPEAT  

        RETURN polarity * accumulatedNumber  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION myAtoi(s)  
        SET INT_MAX TO two RAISED TO THE POWER OF thirty ONE MINUS one  
        SET INT_MIN TO the NEGATIVE of two RAISED TO THE POWER OF thirty ONE  
        SET result TO zero  
        SET index TO zero  
        SET n TO the LENGTH OF s  
        SET sign TO one  
        WHILE index LESS THAN n AND element at position index of s EQUALS the space character  
            INCREMENT index BY one  
        END WHILE  
        IF index LESS THAN n AND (element at position index of s EQUALS the plus character OR element at position index of s EQUALS the minus character)  
            IF element at position index of s EQUALS the minus character  
                SET sign TO the NEGATIVE of one  
            ELSE  
                SET sign TO one  
            END IF  
            INCREMENT index BY one  
        END IF  
        WHILE index LESS THAN n AND element at position index of s IS A DIGIT  
            SET digit TO the INTEGER VALUE OF element at position index of s  
            IF result GREATER THAN INT_MAX MINUS digit DIVIDED BY ten  
                IF sign EQUALS one  
                    RETURN INT_MAX  
                ELSE  
                    RETURN INT_MIN  
                END IF  
            END IF  
            SET result TO result MULTIPLIED BY ten PLUS digit  
            INCREMENT index BY one  
        END WHILE  
        RETURN sign MULTIPLIED BY result  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION isMatch(s, p)  
        DECLARE table AS two-dimensional array FILLED WITH False, SIZE (length(s) + 1) BY (length(p) + 1)  
        ASSIGN table[0][0] ← True  

        SET indexP TO 1  
        WHILE indexP ≤ length(p)  
            IF p[indexP - 1] = '*' THEN  
                ASSIGN table[0][indexP] ← table[0][indexP - 1]  
            END IF  
            INCREMENT indexP BY 1  
        END WHILE  

        SET indexS TO 1  
        WHILE indexS ≤ length(s)  
            SET indexPTmp TO 1  
            WHILE indexPTmp ≤ length(p)  
                IF p[indexPTmp - 1] = '*' THEN  
                    ASSIGN table[indexS][indexPTmp] ← (table[indexS - 1][indexPTmp] OR table[indexS][indexPTmp - 1])  
                ELSE  
                    IF (p[indexPTmp - 1] = '?' OR s[indexS - 1] = p[indexPTmp - 1]) THEN  
                        ASSIGN table[indexS][indexPTmp] ← table[indexS - 1][indexPTmp - 1]  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
                SET indexPTmp ← indexPTmp + 1  
            END WHILE  
            SET indexS ← indexS + 1  
        END WHILE  

        RETURN table[length(s)][length(p)]  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION removeDuplicates(nums)  
        IF NOT (LENGTH OF nums > 0) THEN  
            RETURN 0  
        END IF  
        
        SET ptr AS 0  
        
        SET idx AS 0  
        WHILE idx <= (2 MINUS 1) AND idx <= (LENGTH OF nums MINUS 1)  
            ASSIGN nums[ptr] AS nums[idx]  
            SET ptr AS ptr + 1  
            SET idx AS idx + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET cursor AS 2  
        WHILE cursor <= (LENGTH OF nums MINUS 1)  
            IF nums[cursor] = nums[(ptr MINUS 2)] THEN  
                # do nothing, skip increment  
            ELSE  
                ASSIGN nums[ptr] AS nums[cursor]  
                SET ptr AS ptr PLUS 1  
            END IF  
            SET cursor AS cursor + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN ptr  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION evalRPN(tokens)
        INITIALIZE ledger WITH empty collection
        INITIALIZE index TO 0
        WHILE index LESS THAN LENGTH OF tokens
            LET current_token BE tokens[index]
            INCREMENT index BY 1
            SWITCH current_token
                CASE plus, minus, multiply, divide:
                    LET right_operand BE ledger.REMOVE_LAST_ELEMENT()
                    LET left_operand BE ledger.REMOVE_LAST_ELEMENT()
                    IF current_token EQUALS plus THEN
                        SET operation_result TO left_operand PLUS right_operand
                    ELSE IF current_token EQUALS minus THEN
                        SET operation_result TO left_operand MINUS right_operand
                    ELSE IF current_token EQUALS multiply THEN
                        SET operation_result TO left_operand MULTIPLIED BY right_operand
                    ELSE /* current_token EQUALS divide */
                        SET intermediate_result TO left_operand DIVIDED BY right_operand
                        SET operation_result TO INTEGER_VALUE_OF(intermediate_result)
                    END IF
                    ledger.ADD_ELEMENT(operation_result)
                DEFAULT:
                    LET numeric_value BE INTEGER_VALUE_OF(current_token)
                    ledger.ADD_ELEMENT(numeric_value)
            END SWITCH
        END WHILE
        RETURN ledger[0]
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION evalRPN(tokens)  
        SET stack TO an empty list  
        FOR each token IN tokens  
            IF token EQUALS one of the symbols plus MINUS MULTIPLY DIVIDE  
                SET b TO the last element removed from stack  
                SET a TO the last element removed from stack  
                IF token EQUALS plus  
                    APPEND a PLUS b TO stack  
                ELSE IF token EQUALS minus  
                    APPEND a MINUS b TO stack  
                ELSE IF token EQUALS multiply  
                    APPEND a MULTIPLIED BY b TO stack  
                ELSE IF token EQUALS divide  
                    APPEND the integer value of a DIVIDED BY b TO stack  
                END IF  
            ELSE  
                APPEND the integer value of token TO stack  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        RETURN the element at position zero of stack  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION fractionToDecimal(numerator, denominator)  
        DECLARE polarity AS string  
        IF (numerator < 0 AND denominator >= 0) OR (numerator >= 0 AND denominator < 0) THEN  
            polarity ← "-"  
        ELSE  
            polarity ← ""  
        ENDIF  
  
        numerator ← ABS(numerator)  
        denominator ← ABS(denominator)  
  
        DECLARE integralQuotient AS integer ← numerator DIV denominator  
        DECLARE modValue AS integer ← numerator MOD denominator  
        DECLARE integerString AS string ← TO_STRING(integralQuotient)  
  
        IF modValue = 0 THEN  
            RETURN CONCAT(polarity, integerString)  
        ENDIF  
  
        DECLARE remainderPositions AS MAP FROM integer TO integer ← EMPTY MAP  
        DECLARE digits AS LIST OF string ← EMPTY LIST  
  
        DECLARE currentRemainder AS integer ← modValue  
        WHILE currentRemainder ≠ 0 DO  
            IF remainderPositions CONTAINS currentRemainder THEN  
                DECLARE cycleStart AS integer ← remainderPositions[currentRemainder]  
                DECLARE prefix AS string ← ""  
                DECLARE suffix AS string ← ""  
                FOR idx FROM 0 TO cycleStart - 1 DO  
                    prefix ← CONCAT(prefix, digits[idx])  
                ENDFOR  
                FOR idx FROM cycleStart TO LENGTH(digits) - 1 DO  
                    suffix ← CONCAT(suffix, digits[idx])  
                ENDFOR  
                RETURN CONCAT(polarity, integerString, ".", prefix, "(", suffix, ")")  
            ENDIF  
  
            remainderPositions[currentRemainder] ← LENGTH(digits)  
  
            currentRemainder ← currentRemainder * 10  
            DECLARE digitValue AS integer ← currentRemainder DIV denominator  
            currentRemainder ← currentRemainder MOD denominator  
            APPEND TO digits: TO_STRING(digitValue)  
        ENDWHILE  
  
        RETURN CONCAT(polarity, integerString, ".", JOIN(digits))  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION fractionToDecimal(numerator, denominator)  
        IF numerator LESS THAN zero AND denominator GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO zero OR numerator GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO zero AND denominator LESS THAN zero  
            SET sign TO the string indicating negative  
        ELSE  
            SET sign TO the empty string  
        END IF  
  
        SET numerator TO the absolute value of numerator  
        SET denominator TO the absolute value of denominator  
  
        SET quotient TO the integer division result of numerator DIVIDED BY denominator  
        SET remainder TO the remainder of numerator DIVIDED BY denominator  
        SET integer_part TO the string representation of quotient  
  
        IF remainder EQUALS zero  
            RETURN the concatenation of sign and integer_part  
        END IF  
  
        SET seen_remainders TO an empty mapping from remainder values to positions  
        SET fractional_part TO an empty list  
  
        WHILE remainder NOT EQUALS zero  
            IF remainder EXISTS AS a key in seen_remainders  
                SET start TO the value associated with remainder in seen_remainders  
                SET non_repeating TO the concatenation of elements from position zero UP TO position start EXCLUDING start in fractional_part  
                SET repeating TO the concatenation of elements FROM position start TO the end of fractional_part  
                RETURN the concatenation of sign, integer_part, the string representing a decimal point, non_repeating, the opening parenthesis string, repeating, and the closing parenthesis string  
            END IF  
  
            ASSIGN to seen_remainders at key remainder the current length of fractional_part  
  
            SET remainder TO remainder MULTIPLIED BY ten  
            SET quotient TO the integer division result of remainder DIVIDED BY denominator  
            SET remainder TO the remainder of remainder DIVIDED BY denominator  
            APPEND the string representation of quotient TO fractional_part  
        END WHILE  
  
        RETURN the concatenation of sign, integer_part, the string representing a decimal point, and the concatenation of all elements in fractional_part  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION countPrimes WITH PARAMETER n  
        SWITCH  
            CASE n > 2:  
                BREAK  
            DEFAULT:  
                RETURN 0  
        END SWITCH  
        SET primality_flags AS empty list  
        SET counter AS 0  
        WHILE counter IS LESS THAN n DO  
            ADD True TO primality_flags  
            SET counter TO counter + 1  
        END WHILE  
        SET primality_flags[0] TO False  
        SET primality_flags[1] TO False  
        SET max_check AS FLOOR(SQRT(n))  
        SET candidate AS 2  
        WHILE candidate <= max_check DO  
            IF primality_flags[candidate] IS NOT False THEN  
                SET factor AS candidate * candidate  
                WHILE factor < n DO  
                    SET primality_flags[factor] TO False  
                    SET factor TO factor + candidate  
                END WHILE  
            END IF  
            SET candidate TO candidate + 1  
        END WHILE  
        SET tally AS 0  
        FOR element IN primality_flags DO  
            IF element THEN tally ← tally + 1  
        END FOR  
        RETURN tally  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION countPrimes WITH PARAMETER n  
        IF n LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO two  
            RETURN zero  
        END IF  
        SET is_prime TO an empty list  
        FOR index FROM zero TO n MINUS one  
            APPEND True TO is_prime  
        END FOR  
        SET element at position zero of is_prime TO False  
        SET element at position one of is_prime TO False  
        SET limit TO the integer part of the square root of n  
        FOR start FROM two TO limit PLUS one  
            IF element at position start of is_prime EQUALS True  
                SET multiple TO start MULTIPLIED BY start  
                WHILE multiple LESS THAN n  
                    SET element at position multiple of is_prime TO False  
                    INCREMENT multiple BY start  
                END WHILE  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        SET count TO zero  
        FOR each value IN is_prime  
            IF value EQUALS True  
                INCREMENT count BY one  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        RETURN count  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION diffWaysToCompute(expression)
        FUNCTION compute(left, right, operator)
            ASSIGN [] TO outcomes
            SET l_index TO 0
            WHILE l_index < LENGTH of left
                SET r_pos TO 0
                WHILE r_pos < LENGTH of right
                    SET current_left TO left[l_index]
                    SET current_right TO right[r_pos]
                    IF NOT (operator != "+") THEN
                        outcomes := outcomes + [current_left + current_right]
                    ELSE IF NOT (operator != "-") THEN
                        outcomes := outcomes + [current_left - current_right]
                    ELSE IF NOT (operator != "*") THEN
                        outcomes := outcomes + [current_left * current_right]
                    END IF
                    r_pos = r_pos + 1
                END WHILE
                l_index = l_index + 1
            END WHILE
            RETURN outcomes
        END FUNCTION

        FUNCTION helper(sub_expr)
            IF sub_expr CONTAINS ONLY digits THEN
                RETURN [TO_INTEGER(sub_expr)]
            END IF

            SET collected TO []
            SET pointer TO 0
            WHILE pointer < LENGTH(sub_expr)
                SET ch TO sub_expr[pointer]
                IF ch EQUALS "+" OR ch EQUALS "-" OR ch EQUALS "*" THEN
                    ASSIGN helper(SUBSTRING(sub_expr, 0, pointer)) TO left_group
                    ASSIGN helper(SUBSTRING(sub_expr, pointer+1, LENGTH(sub_expr)-1)) TO right_group
                    FOR each val IN compute(left_group, right_group, ch)
                        collected := collected + [val]
                    END FOR
                END IF
                POINTER_INCREMENT pointer BY 1
            END WHILE
            RETURN collected
        END FUNCTION

        RETURN helper(expression)
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION diffWaysToCompute(expression)  
        FUNCTION compute(left, right, operator)  
            SET results TO an empty list  
            FOR each l IN left  
                FOR each r IN right  
                    IF operator EQUALS the plus symbol  
                        APPEND l PLUS r TO results  
                    ELSE IF operator EQUALS the minus symbol  
                        APPEND l MINUS r TO results  
                    ELSE IF operator EQUALS the multiplication symbol  
                        APPEND l MULTIPLIED BY r TO results  
                    END IF  
                END FOR  
            END FOR  
            RETURN results  
        END FUNCTION  
      
        FUNCTION helper(sub_expr)  
            IF the entirety of sub_expr CONSISTS OF DIGITS  
                RETURN a list containing the integer value of sub_expr  
            END IF  
          
            SET results TO an empty list  
            FOR index i FROM zero TO the LENGTH OF sub_expr MINUS one  
                IF the element at position i of sub_expr EQUALS any of the plus symbol OR the minus symbol OR the multiplication symbol  
                    SET left_results TO helper(the substring of sub_expr from position zero TO position i MINUS one)  
                    SET right_results TO helper(the substring of sub_expr from position i PLUS one TO the last position)  
                    FOR each result IN compute(left_results, right_results, the element at position i of sub_expr)  
                        APPEND result TO results  
                    END FOR  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
            RETURN results  
        END FUNCTION  
      
        RETURN helper(expression)  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION strobogrammaticInRange(low  
                                    high)
        FUNCTION generate_strobogrammatic(n  
                                         final_length)
            SWITCH n
                CASE 0:
                    RETURN [""]

                CASE 1:
                    RETURN ["0", "1", "8"]
            END SWITCH

            SET innerStrings AS generate_strobogrammatic(final_length - 2, final_length)
            SET collection AS []

            SET idx TO 0
            WHILE idx < LENGTH(innerStrings)
                SET segment TO innerStrings[idx]

                IF n IS DIFFERENT FROM final_length THEN
                    INSERT "0" + segment + "0" INTO collection AT END
                END IF

                INSERT "1" + segment + "1" INTO collection AT END
                INSERT "6" + segment + "9" INTO collection AT END
                INSERT "8" + segment + "8" INTO collection AT END
                INSERT "9" + segment + "6" INTO collection AT END

                idx ← idx + 1
            END WHILE

            RETURN collection
        END FUNCTION

        FUNCTION count_strobogrammatic(low  
                                       high)
            SET total AS 0
            SET lenLow TO LENGTH(low)
            SET lenHigh TO LENGTH(high)

            SET currentLen TO lenLow
            WHILE currentLen <= lenHigh
                SET generatedList AS generate_strobogrammatic(currentLen, currentLen)
                SET pointer TO 0

                WHILE pointer < LENGTH(generatedList)
                    SET numberStr TO generatedList[pointer]

                    IF NOT ((currentLen = lenLow AND numberStr < low) OR (currentLen = lenHigh AND numberStr > high)) THEN
                        total ← total + 1
                    END IF

                    pointer ← pointer + 1
                END WHILE

                currentLen ← currentLen + 1
            END WHILE

            RETURN total
        END FUNCTION

        RETURN count_strobogrammatic(low, high)
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION strobogrammaticInRange(low  
                                    high)  
        FUNCTION generate_strobogrammatic(n  
                                         final_length)  
            IF n EQUALS zero  
                RETURN a list containing an empty string  
            END IF  
            
            IF n EQUALS one  
                RETURN a list containing the string zero once the string one once the string eight  
            END IF  
            
            SET middles TO the result of calling generate_strobogrammatic with arguments n MINUS two and final_length  
            SET result TO an empty list  
            FOR each middle IN middles  
                IF n NOT EQUALS final_length  
                    APPEND the string zero PLUS middle PLUS zero TO result  
                END IF  
                APPEND the string one PLUS middle PLUS one TO result  
                APPEND the string six PLUS middle PLUS nine TO result  
                APPEND the string eight PLUS middle PLUS eight TO result  
                APPEND the string nine PLUS middle PLUS six TO result  
            END FOR  
            RETURN result  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        FUNCTION count_strobogrammatic(low  
                                       high)  
            SET count TO zero  
            FOR length FROM the length of low TO the length of high  
                FOR each num IN the result of calling generate_strobogrammatic with arguments length and length  
                    IF (length EQUALS the length of low AND num LESS THAN low) OR (length EQUALS the length of high AND num GREATER THAN high)  
                        CONTINUE to the next iteration  
                    END IF  
                    INCREMENT count BY one  
                END FOR  
            END FOR  
            RETURN count  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        RETURN the result of calling count_strobogrammatic with arguments low and high  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION canWin(currentState)
        DECLARE cache AS an empty map

        FUNCTION can_win_helper(state)
            IF NOT (state NOT IN cache) THEN
                RETURN cache[state]
            END IF

            DECLARE iterator AS 0
            WHILE iterator <= LENGTH(state) - 2 DO
                IF (state[iterator] = '+') AND (state[iterator + 1] = '+') THEN
                    DECLARE before_segment AS SUBSTRING(state, 0, iterator)
                    DECLARE after_segment AS SUBSTRING(state, iterator + 2, LENGTH(state))
                    DECLARE candidate_state AS CONCATENATE(before_segment, '--', after_segment)

                    IF FALSE = can_win_helper(candidate_state) THEN
                        ASSIGN TRUE TO cache[state]
                        RETURN TRUE
                    END IF
                END IF
                ASSIGN iterator + 1 TO iterator
            END WHILE

            ASSIGN FALSE TO cache[state]
            RETURN FALSE
        END FUNCTION

        RETURN can_win_helper(currentState)
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION canWin(currentState)  
        SET memo TO an empty dictionary  
        
        FUNCTION can_win_helper(state)  
            IF state EXISTS IN memo THEN  
                RETURN the value associated with state in memo  
            END IF  
            
            FOR index FROM zero TO the LENGTH OF state MINUS one MINUS one  
                IF the element at position index of state EQUALS the plus character AND the element at position index PLUS one of state EQUALS the plus character THEN  
                    SET new_state TO the substring from position zero TO position index MINUS one CONCATENATED WITH two minus characters CONCATENATED WITH the substring from position index PLUS two TO the END OF state  
                    IF the result of calling can_win_helper WITH new_state IS EQUAL TO false THEN  
                        SET the value associated with state in memo TO true  
                        RETURN true  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
            
            SET the value associated with state in memo TO false  
            RETURN false  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        RETURN the result of calling can_win_helper WITH currentState  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION getHint(secret PARAMETER, guess PARAMETER)  
        IMPORT a data structure offering a dictionary with zero as the default for any missing key  
        
        SET alpha TO 0  
        SET beta TO 0  
        
        CREATE secret_map AS a dictionary defaulting to zero  
        CREATE guess_map AS a dictionary defaulting to zero  
        
        SET counter TO 0  
        WHILE counter LESS THAN LENGTH(secret)  
            SET secret_char TO secret[counter]  
            SET guess_char TO guess[counter]  
            
            IF NOT (secret_char DIFFERENT FROM guess_char) THEN
                SET alpha TO alpha + 1
            ELSE
                INCREASE secret_map[secret_char] BY 1
                INCREASE guess_map[guess_char] BY 1
            END IF  
            SET counter TO counter + 1
        END WHILE  
        
        FOR each key_element IN secret_map KEYS  
            SET min_val TO guess_map[key_element]  
            IF min_val GREATER THAN secret_map[key_element] THEN
                SET min_val TO secret_map[key_element]
            END IF
            SET beta TO beta + min_val
        END FOR  
        
        RETURN (string CONCAT alpha CONCAT "A" CONCAT beta CONCAT "B")  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

    FUNCTION getHint(secret PARAMETER, guess PARAMETER)

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION isRectangleCover(rectangles)  
        LET minX BE positive infinity  
        LET minY BE positive infinity  
        LET maxX BE negative infinity  
        LET maxY BE negative infinity  
        
        INITIALIZE corners AS empty set  
        DEFINE totalArea AS 0  
        
        DEFINE idx AS 0  
        WHILE idx LESS THAN LENGTH OF rectangles DO  
            LET rect BE rectangles[idx]  
            LET leftX BE rect[0]  
            LET bottomY BE rect[1]  
            LET rightX BE rect[2]  
            LET topY BE rect[3]  
            
            IF NOT (leftX >= minX) THEN  
                minX ← leftX  
            END IF  
            IF NOT (bottomY >= minY) THEN  
                minY ← bottomY  
            END IF  
            IF NOT (rightX <= maxX) THEN  
                maxX ← rightX  
            END IF  
            IF NOT (topY <= maxY) THEN  
                maxY ← topY  
            END IF  
            
            LET rectArea BE (rightX - leftX)  
            LET height BE (topY - bottomY)  
            LET thisArea BE rectArea * height  
            totalArea ← totalArea + thisArea  
            
            LET cornerPoints BE list of pairs: (leftX, bottomY), (leftX, topY), (rightX, bottomY), (rightX, topY)  
            
            LET ctr AS 0  
            WHILE ctr LESS THAN LENGTH OF cornerPoints DO  
                LET corner BE cornerPoints[ctr]  
                IF corners CONTAINS corner THEN  
                    REMOVE corner FROM corners  
                ELSE  
                    INSERT corner INTO corners  
                END IF  
                ctr ← ctr + 1  
            END WHILE  
            idx ← idx + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        LET fullWidth BE maxX - minX  
        LET fullHeight BE maxY - minY  
        LET expectedArea BE fullWidth * fullHeight  
        
        IF totalArea IS NOT expectedArea THEN  
            RETURN False  
        END IF  
        
        LET requiredCorners BE set of pairs: (minX, minY), (minX, maxY), (maxX, minY), (maxX, maxY)  
        IF corners IS NOT EQUAL TO requiredCorners THEN  
            RETURN False  
        END IF  
        
        RETURN True  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION wordsTyping(sentence, rows, cols)  
        ASSIGN concatenated_string TO EMPTY STRING  
        INITIALIZE index_counter TO 0  
        
        WHILE index_counter LESS THAN LENGTH OF sentence  
            CONCATENATE concatenated_string WITH sentence[index_counter]  
            CONCATENATE concatenated_string WITH " "  
            INCREMENT index_counter BY 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        ASSIGN length_total TO LENGTH OF concatenated_string  
        SET pointer TO 0  
        ASSIGN row_iter TO 1  
        
        WHILE row_iter LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO rows  
            ADD cols TO pointer  
            IF concatenated_string[pointer MOD length_total] IS " " THEN  
                INCREMENT pointer BY 1  
            ELSE  
                WHILE (pointer GREATER THAN 0) AND (concatenated_string[(pointer - 1) MOD length_total] IS NOT " ")  
                    DECREASE pointer BY 1  
                END WHILE  
            END IF  
            INCREMENT row_iter BY 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN INTEGER_DIVISION OF pointer BY length_total  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION strongPasswordChecker(password)
        SET length_password AS LENGTH OF password
        SET lower_found AS EXISTS character IN password WHERE character IS lowercase letter
        SET upper_found AS EXISTS character IN password WHERE character IS uppercase letter
        SET digit_found AS EXISTS character IN password WHERE character IS digit

        SET missing_char_types AS 3 MINUS (lower_found PLUS upper_found PLUS digit_found)

        SET replacements_needed TO 0
        SET count_mod0 TO 0
        SET count_mod1 TO 0
        SET index_counter TO 2

        WHILE index_counter < length_password
            IF (password[index_counter] EQUALS password[index_counter - 1]) AND (password[index_counter] EQUALS password[index_counter - 2])
                SET streak_length TO 2
                WHILE (index_counter < length_password) AND (password[index_counter] EQUALS password[index_counter - 1])
                    SET streak_length TO (streak_length PLUS 1)
                    SET index_counter TO (index_counter PLUS 1)
                END WHILE

                SET replacements_needed TO replacements_needed PLUS (streak_length DIV 3)

                IF (streak_length MOD 3) EQUALS 0
                    SET count_mod0 TO count_mod0 PLUS 1
                ELSE IF (streak_length MOD 3) EQUALS 1
                    SET count_mod1 TO count_mod1 PLUS 1
                END IF
            ELSE
                SET index_counter TO (index_counter PLUS 1)
            END IF
        END WHILE

        IF length_password < 6
            RETURN MAXIMUM OF missing_char_types AND (6 MINUS length_password)
        ELSE IF length_password <= 20
            RETURN MAXIMUM OF missing_char_types AND replacements_needed
        ELSE
            SET excess_length TO length_password MINUS 20

            SET min_del0 AS MINIMUM OF excess_length AND count_mod0
            SET replacements_needed TO replacements_needed MINUS min_del0

            SET remaining_after_del0 TO MAXIMUM OF (excess_length MINUS min_del0) AND 0
            SET min_del1 AS MINIMUM OF remaining_after_del0 AND (count_mod1 TIMES 2)
            SET replacements_needed TO replacements_needed MINUS (min_del1 DIV 2)

            SET remaining_after_del1 TO MAXIMUM OF (remaining_after_del0 MINUS min_del1) AND 0
            SET replacements_needed TO replacements_needed MINUS (remaining_after_del1 DIV 3)

            RETURN excess_length PLUS MAXIMUM OF missing_char_types AND replacements_needed
        END IF
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION strongPasswordChecker(password)  
        SET n TO the LENGTH OF password  
        
        SET has_lower TO BOOLEAN VALUE OF WHETHER any character IN password is a lowercase letter  
        SET has_upper TO BOOLEAN VALUE OF WHETHER any character IN password is an uppercase letter  
        SET has_digit TO BOOLEAN VALUE OF WHETHER any character IN password is a digit  
        
        SET missing_types TO three MINUS the SUM OF has_lower PLUS has_upper PLUS has_digit  
        
        SET replace TO zero  
        SET one TO zero  
        SET two TO zero  
        SET i TO two  
        WHILE i LESS THAN n  
            IF the character at position i of password EQUALS the character at position i MINUS one of password AND the character at position i of password EQUALS the character at position i MINUS two of password  
                SET length TO two  
                WHILE i LESS THAN n AND the character at position i of password EQUALS the character at position i MINUS one of password  
                    INCREMENT length BY one  
                    INCREMENT i BY one  
                END WHILE  
                INCREMENT replace BY the INTEGER DIVISION of length BY three  
                IF the MODULO of length BY three EQUALS zero  
                    INCREMENT one BY one  
                ELSE IF the MODULO of length BY three EQUALS one  
                    INCREMENT two BY one  
                END IF  
            ELSE  
                INCREMENT i BY one  
            END IF  
        END WHILE  
        
        IF n LESS THAN six  
            RETURN the GREATER VALUE BETWEEN missing_types AND six MINUS n  
        ELSE IF n LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO twenty  
            RETURN the GREATER VALUE BETWEEN missing_types AND replace  
        ELSE  
            SET delete TO n MINUS twenty  
            
            SET replace TO replace MINUS the SMALLER VALUE BETWEEN delete AND one  
            SET replace TO replace MINUS the INTEGER DIVISION BY two OF the SMALLER VALUE BETWEEN the GREATER VALUE BETWEEN delete MINUS one AND zero AND two MULTIPLIED BY two  
            SET replace TO replace MINUS the INTEGER DIVISION BY three OF the GREATER VALUE BETWEEN delete MINUS one MINUS two MULTIPLIED BY two AND zero  
            
            RETURN delete PLUS the GREATER VALUE BETWEEN missing_types AND replace  
        END IF  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION wordSquares(words)
        SET lookup TO an empty mapping from string to list of strings

        SET w_index TO 0
        WHILE w_index < LENGTH(words)
            SET current_word TO words[w_index]
            SET i TO 0
            WHILE i < LENGTH(current_word)
                SET key TO substring(current_word, 0, i)
                IF NOT lookup HAS KEY key THEN
                    lookup[key] ← an empty list
                END IF
                SET word_list TO lookup[key]
                word_list ← word_list + [current_word]
                lookup[key] ← word_list
                i ← i + 1
            END WHILE
            w_index ← w_index + 1
        END WHILE

        SET output TO an empty list

        FUNCTION backtrack(square)
            IF NOT LENGTH(square) ≠ LENGTH(words[0]) THEN
                output ← output + [square]
                RETURN
            END IF

            SET build_prefix TO ""
            SET idx TO 0
            WHILE idx < LENGTH(square)
                SET temp_word TO square[idx]
                SET prefix_char TO temp_word[LENGTH(square)]
                build_prefix ← build_prefix + prefix_char
                idx ← idx + 1
            END WHILE

            IF lookup HAS KEY build_prefix THEN
                SET candidates_list TO lookup[build_prefix]
                SET c_idx TO 0
                WHILE c_idx < LENGTH(candidates_list)
                    SET next_word TO candidates_list[c_idx]
                    backtrack(square + [next_word])
                    c_idx ← c_idx + 1
                END WHILE
            END IF
        END FUNCTION

        FOR EACH initial_word IN words
            backtrack([initial_word])
        END FOR

        RETURN output
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION wordSquares(words)  
        SET prefix_to_words TO an empty mapping from string to list of strings  
        FOR each word IN words  
            FOR index FROM zero TO the LENGTH OF word MINUS one  
                SET prefix TO the substring of word from position zero TO position index MINUS one  
                APPEND word TO the list at prefix_to_words corresponding to prefix  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        
        SET results TO an empty list  
        
        FUNCTION backtrack(square)  
            IF the LENGTH OF square EQUALS the LENGTH OF the first element of words THEN  
                APPEND square TO results  
                RETURN  
            END IF  
            
            SET prefix TO an empty string  
            FOR each word_element IN square  
                APPEND the element at position the LENGTH OF square of word_element TO prefix  
            END FOR  
            
            FOR each candidate IN the list at prefix_to_words corresponding to prefix  
                CALL backtrack WITH the argument of the concatenation of square with candidate as a new list element  
            END FOR  
        END FUNCTION  
        
        FOR each word IN words  
            CALL backtrack WITH a list containing only word  
        END FOR  
        
        RETURN results  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION numberOfArithmeticSlices(nums)  
        SET lengthVal AS LENGTH(nums)  
        IF NOT(lengthVal GREATER OR EQUAL TO 3) THEN  
            RETURN 0  
        END IF  
        
        SET dpList AS AN EMPTY list  
        SET idxCounter TO 0  
        WHILE idxCounter LESS THAN lengthVal DO  
            APPEND a new default dictionary mapping integer TO integer TO dpList  
            INCREMENT idxCounter BY 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        SET aggregateCount TO 0  
        
        SET outerIdx TO 0  
        WHILE outerIdx LESS THAN lengthVal DO  
            SET innerIdx TO 0  
            WHILE innerIdx LESS THAN outerIdx DO  
                SET diffDelta AS nums[outerIdx] MINUS nums[innerIdx]  
                
                IF diffDelta IN dpList[innerIdx] THEN  
                    SET prevVal TO dpList[innerIdx][diffDelta]  
                    SET dpList[outerIdx][diffDelta] TO dpList[outerIdx].GET(diffDelta, 0) PLUS prevVal PLUS 1  
                    SET aggregateCount TO aggregateCount PLUS prevVal  
                ELSE  
                    SET dpList[outerIdx][diffDelta] TO dpList[outerIdx].GET(diffDelta, 0) PLUS 1  
                END IF  
                
                INCREMENT innerIdx BY 1  
            END WHILE  
            INCREMENT outerIdx BY 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN aggregateCount  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION findMaxForm(strs, m, n)  
        DECLARE matrix AS LIST OF LIST OF INTEGER ← LIST CONTAINING (m + 1) ELEMENTS, EACH BEING A LIST OF (n + 1) ZEROS  
        
        INDEX ← 0  
        WHILE INDEX < LENGTH OF strs  
            STRING currentString ← strs AT INDEX  
            ZEROES ← 0  
            ONES ← 0  
            
            POSITION ← 0  
            WHILE POSITION < LENGTH OF currentString  
                CHARACTER char ← currentString AT POSITION  
                IF char = '0' THEN  
                    ZEROES ← ZEROES + 1  
                ELSE IF char = '1' THEN  
                    ONES ← ONES + 1  
                END IF  
                POSITION ← POSITION + 1  
            END WHILE  
            
            iCounter ← m  
            WHILE iCounter >= ZEROES  
                jCounter ← n  
                REPEAT  
                    currentVal ← matrix AT iCounter AT jCounter  
                    candidateVal ← matrix AT (iCounter - ZEROES) AT (jCounter - ONES) + 1  
                    
                    IF candidateVal > currentVal THEN  
                        matrix AT iCounter AT jCounter ← candidateVal  
                    END IF  
                    jCounter ← jCounter - 1  
                UNTIL jCounter < ONES  
                iCounter ← iCounter - 1  
            END WHILE  
            
            INDEX ← INDEX + 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN matrix AT m AT n  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

        FOR each string s IN strs  
            SET count_0 TO the number of elements EQUALS to zero in the string s  
            SET count_1 TO the number of elements EQUALS to one in the string s  
            FOR variable i FROM m DOWN TO count_0  
                FOR variable j FROM n DOWN TO count_1  
                    SET dp at position i and position j TO the maximum value between dp at position i and position j AND the value of dp at position i MINUS count_0 and position j MINUS count_1 PLUS one  
                END FOR  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        RETURN dp at position m and position n  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION medianSlidingWindow(nums k)
        ASSIGN [] TO alpha
        ASSIGN [] TO beta

        FUNCTION balance_heaps()
            WHEN LENGTH(alpha) > LENGTH(beta) + 1:
                CALL heappush beta NEGATE CALL heappop alpha
            OTHERWISE WHEN LENGTH(beta) > LENGTH(alpha):
                CALL heappush alpha NEGATE CALL heappop beta
            END WHEN
        END FUNCTION

        FUNCTION add_num(delta)
            WHEN LENGTH(alpha) = 0 OR delta <= NEGATE alpha[0]:
                CALL heappush alpha NEGATE delta
            OTHERWISE:
                CALL heappush beta delta
            END WHEN
            CALL balance_heaps()
        END FUNCTION

        FUNCTION remove_num(delta)
            WHEN delta <= NEGATE alpha[0]:
                DELETE element NEGATE delta FROM alpha
                WHEN LENGTH(alpha) > 0:
                    CALL heapify alpha
                END WHEN
            OTHERWISE:
                DELETE element delta FROM beta
                WHEN LENGTH(beta) > 0:
                    CALL heapify beta
                END WHEN
            END WHEN
            CALL balance_heaps()
        END FUNCTION

        FUNCTION get_median()
            WHEN LENGTH(alpha) > LENGTH(beta):
                RETURN NEGATE alpha[0]
            END WHEN
            RETURN (NEGATE alpha[0] + beta[0]) / 2
        END FUNCTION

        ASSIGN 0 TO mu
        WHILE mu < k:
            CALL add_num nums[mu]
            ASSIGN mu + 1 TO mu
        END WHILE

        ASSIGN [get_median()] TO omegas

        ASSIGN k TO pi
        WHILE NOT (pi >= LENGTH(nums)):
            CALL add_num nums[pi]
            CALL remove_num nums[pi - k]
            APPEND get_median() TO omegas
            ASSIGN pi + 1 TO pi
        END WHILE

        RETURN omegas
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION medianSlidingWindow(nums k)  
        SET lo TO empty list  
        SET hi TO empty list  

        FUNCTION balance_heaps()  
            IF the LENGTH OF lo IS GREATER THAN the LENGTH OF hi PLUS one  
                CALL heappush WITH the argument hi AND NEGATIVE of the result of heappop ON lo  
            ELSE IF the LENGTH OF hi IS GREATER THAN the LENGTH OF lo  
                CALL heappush WITH the argument lo AND NEGATIVE of the result of heappop ON hi  
            END IF  
        END FUNCTION  

        FUNCTION add_num(num)  
            IF lo IS empty OR num IS LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO NEGATIVE of element at position zero of lo  
                CALL heappush WITH the argument lo AND NEGATIVE num  
            ELSE  
                CALL heappush WITH the argument hi AND num  
            END IF  
            CALL balance_heaps()  
        END FUNCTION  

        FUNCTION remove_num(num)  
            IF num IS LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO NEGATIVE of element at position zero of lo  
                REMOVE NEGATIVE num FROM lo  
                IF lo IS NOT empty  
                    CALL heapify WITH the argument lo  
                END IF  
            ELSE  
                REMOVE num FROM hi  
                IF hi IS NOT empty  
                    CALL heapify WITH the argument hi  
                END IF  
            END IF  
            CALL balance_heaps()  
        END FUNCTION  

        FUNCTION get_median()  
            IF the LENGTH OF lo IS GREATER THAN the LENGTH OF hi  
                RETURN NEGATIVE of element at position zero of lo  
            END IF  
            RETURN NEGATIVE of element at position zero of lo PLUS element at position zero of hi DIVIDED BY two  
        END FUNCTION  

        FOR i FROM zero TO k MINUS one  
            CALL add_num WITH element at position i of nums  
        END FOR  

        SET medians TO a list containing the result of get_median()  

        FOR i FROM k TO the LENGTH OF nums MINUS one  
            CALL add_num WITH element at position i of nums  
            CALL remove_num WITH element at position i MINUS k of nums  
            APPEND the result of get_median() TO medians  
        END FOR  

        RETURN medians  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION minDistance(word1, word2)  
        ASSIGN length1 ← LENGTH OF word1  
        ASSIGN length2 ← LENGTH OF word2  
        
        CREATE dp AS a list of (length1 PLUS 1) elements, EACH BEING a list of (length2 PLUS 1) zeros  
        
        ASSIGN outerCounter ← 1  
        WHILE outerCounter <= length1  
            ASSIGN innerCounter ← 1  
            WHILE innerCounter <= length2  
                ASSIGN charFromWord1 ← word1[outerCounter MINUS 1]  
                ASSIGN charFromWord2 ← word2[innerCounter MINUS 1]  
                
                IF NOT (charFromWord1 NOT EQUAL TO charFromWord2) THEN  
                    SET dp[outerCounter][innerCounter] ← dp[outerCounter MINUS 1][innerCounter MINUS 1] PLUS 1  
                ELSE  
                    ASSIGN topValue ← dp[outerCounter MINUS 1][innerCounter]  
                    ASSIGN leftValue ← dp[outerCounter][innerCounter MINUS 1]  
                    
                    IF topValue >= leftValue THEN  
                        SET dp[outerCounter][innerCounter] ← topValue  
                    ELSE  
                        SET dp[outerCounter][innerCounter] ← leftValue  
                    END IF  
                END IF  
                
                INCREMENT innerCounter BY 1  
            END WHILE  
            INCREMENT outerCounter BY 1  
        END WHILE  
        
        ASSIGN lcsLength ← dp[length1][length2]  
        
        RETURN (length1 MINUS lcsLength) PLUS (length2 MINUS lcsLength)  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION findIntegers(n)  
        ASSIGN binaryString ← ""  
        ASSIGN tempNumber ← n  
        WHILE tempNumber > 0  
            SET binaryString ← ( (tempNumber MOD 2) AS STRING ) + binaryString  
            SET tempNumber ← tempNumber DIV 2  
        END WHILE

        SET totalLength ← LENGTH OF binaryString  
        CREATE dp ARRAY WITH SIZE totalLength + 1 FILLED WITH 0  
        SET dp[0] ← 1  
        SET dp[1] ← 2  

        SET counter ← 2  
        WHILE counter ≤ totalLength  
            SET dp[counter] ← dp[counter - 1] + dp[counter - 2]  
            INCREMENT counter BY 1  
        END WHILE

        SET accumulatedResult ← 0  
        SET lastBit ← 0  
        SET position ← 0  

        WHILE position < totalLength  
            SWITCH binaryString[position]  
                CASE '1':  
                    SET accumulatedResult ← accumulatedResult + dp[totalLength - position - 1]  
                    IF lastBit = 1 THEN  
                        SET accumulatedResult ← accumulatedResult - 1  
                        BREAK OUT OF LOOP  
                    END IF  
                    SET lastBit ← 1  
                DEFAULT:  
                    SET lastBit ← 0  
            END SWITCH  
            SET position ← position + 1  
        END WHILE

        RETURN accumulatedResult + 1  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

                END IF  
            END IF

        END FOR  
        RETURN result PLUS one  
    END FUNCTION

    FUNCTION kInversePairs(n, k)

        ASSIGN LIST containing (n + 1) copies of dp_row_template TO dp

            ASSIGN 0 TO cumulative_total
            ASSIGN 0 TO inner_index
            WHILE inner_index <= k
                ASSIGN cumulative_total + dp[outer_counter - 1][inner_index] TO cumulative_total
                IF cumulative_total >= MOD THEN
                    ASSIGN cumulative_total - MOD TO cumulative_total
                END IF
                IF inner_index >= outer_counter THEN

                    IF cumulative_total >= MOD THEN
                        ASSIGN cumulative_total - MOD TO cumulative_total
                    END IF
                END IF
                ASSIGN cumulative_total TO dp[outer_counter][inner_index]
                ADD 1 TO inner_index
            END WHILE
            ADD 1 TO outer_counter
        END WHILE

    END FUNCTION

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION pourWater(heights WITH TYPE List of integers volume WITH TYPE integer k WITH TYPE integer) RETURNS List of integers
        ASSIGN n TO LENGTH(heights)

        SET stepCounter TO 1
        WHILE stepCounter LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO volume
            ASSIGN cursor TO k

            WHILE NOT (cursor EQUALS 0 OR heights[cursor - 1] GREATER THAN heights[cursor])
                SUBTRACT 1 FROM cursor
            END WHILE

            WHILE NOT (cursor EQUALS k OR heights[cursor] NOT EQUAL heights[cursor + 1])
                ADD 1 TO cursor
            END WHILE

            IF NOT cursor GREATER OR EQUAL k THEN
                ASSIGN prevHeight TO heights[cursor]
                ASSIGN updatedHeight TO prevHeight + 1
                ASSIGN heights[cursor] TO updatedHeight
                ADD 1 TO stepCounter
                CONTINUE TO NEXT iteration of WHILE
            END IF

            ASSIGN cursor TO k

            WHILE NOT (cursor EQUALS n - 1 OR heights[cursor + 1] GREATER THAN heights[cursor])
                ADD 1 TO cursor
            END WHILE

            WHILE NOT (cursor EQUALS k OR heights[cursor] NOT EQUAL heights[cursor - 1])
                SUBTRACT 1 FROM cursor
            END WHILE

            IF cursor GREATER THAN k THEN
                ASSIGN baseHeight TO heights[cursor]
                ASSIGN incrementedHeight TO baseHeight + 1
                ASSIGN heights[cursor] TO incrementedHeight
                ADD 1 TO stepCounter
                CONTINUE TO NEXT iteration of WHILE
            END IF

            ASSIGN currentHeight TO heights[k]
            ASSIGN newHeight TO currentHeight + 1
            ASSIGN heights[k] TO newHeight

            ADD 1 TO stepCounter
        END WHILE

        RETURN heights
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION kthSmallestPrimeFraction(arr, k)
        LET totalElements BE LENGTH(arr)
        LET heapElements BE an EMPTY LIST

        LET indexCounter BE 0
        WHILE indexCounter < totalElements - 1
            LET fractionValue BE arr[indexCounter] DIVIDED_BY arr[totalElements - 1]
            INSERT (fractionValue, indexCounter, totalElements - 1) INTO heapElements
            SET indexCounter TO indexCounter + 1
        END WHILE

        LET iterationCounter BE 0
        WHILE iterationCounter < k - 1
            EXTRACT_MIN FROM heapElements INTO (_, idxA, idxB)
            IF (idxB - 1) > idxA THEN
                LET newFraction BE arr[idxA] DIVIDED_BY arr[idxB - 1]
                INSERT (newFraction, idxA, idxB - 1) INTO heapElements
            END IF
            SET iterationCounter TO iterationCounter + 1
        END WHILE

        EXTRACT_MIN FROM heapElements INTO (_, finalI, finalJ)
        RETURN [arr[finalI], arr[finalJ]]
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION new21Game(n INTEGER, k INTEGER, maxPts INTEGER) RETURNS FLOAT
        FUNCTION dfs(pos INTEGER) RETURNS FLOAT
            SWITCH TRUE
                CASE pos >= k:
                    RETURN 1.0 IF pos <= n ELSE 0.0
                CASE pos = k - 1:
                    LET coverage FLOAT = n - k + 1
                    RETURN coverage / maxPts IF coverage < maxPts ELSE 1.0
            END SWITCH

            LET valStart FLOAT = dfs(pos + 1)
            LET valEnd FLOAT = dfs(pos + maxPts + 1)
            LET outcome FLOAT = valStart + (valStart - valEnd) / maxPts
            RETURN outcome
        END FUNCTION

        RETURN dfs(0)
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION new21Game(n INTEGER PARAMETER k INTEGER PARAMETER maxPts INTEGER PARAMETER) RETURNS FLOAT  
        FUNCTION dfs(i INTEGER PARAMETER) RETURNS FLOAT  
            IF i GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO k THEN  
                IF i LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO n THEN  
                    RETURN one  
                ELSE  
                    RETURN zero  
                END IF  
            END IF  
            IF i EQUALS k MINUS one THEN  
                IF n MINUS k PLUS one LESS THAN maxPts THEN  
                    RETURN (n MINUS k PLUS one) DIVIDED BY maxPts  
                ELSE  
                    RETURN one  
                END IF  
            END IF  
            SET first_call TO dfs(i PLUS one)  
            SET second_call TO dfs(i PLUS maxPts PLUS one)  
            SET result TO first_call PLUS (first_call MINUS second_call) DIVIDED BY maxPts  
            RETURN result  
        END FUNCTION  
        RETURN dfs(zero)  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION numMagicSquaresInside(grid)  
        FUNCTION is_magic(i, j)  
            IF grid[i][j] ≠ 5 THEN  
                RETURN False  
            END IF  

            SET unique_values AS empty set  
            SET a AS i - 1  
            WHILE a ≤ i + 1 DO  
                SET b AS j - 1  
                WHILE b ≤ j + 1 DO  
                    SET val AS grid[a][b]  
                    IF val < 1 OR val > 9 OR val IN unique_values THEN  
                        RETURN False  
                    END IF  
                    INSERT val INTO unique_values  
                    b ← b + 1  
                END WHILE  
                a ← a + 1  
            END WHILE  

            SET c AS i - 1  
            REPEAT UNTIL c > i + 1  
                SET row_sum AS grid[c][j - 1] + grid[c][j] + grid[c][j + 1]  
                SET col_sum AS grid[i - 1][c] + grid[i][c] + grid[i + 1][c]  

                IF row_sum ≠ 15 THEN  
                    RETURN False  
                ELSE IF col_sum ≠ 15 THEN  
                    RETURN False  
                END IF  

                c ← c + 1  
            END REPEAT  

            SWITCH TRUE  
                CASE grid[i - 1][j - 1] + grid[i][j] + grid[i + 1][j + 1] ≠ 15:  
                    RETURN False  
                CASE grid[i - 1][j + 1] + grid[i][j] + grid[i + 1][j - 1] ≠ 15:  
                    RETURN False  
            END SWITCH  

            RETURN True  
        END FUNCTION  

        SET total_count AS 0  
        SET row_count AS LENGTH(grid)  
        SET column_count AS LENGTH(grid[0])  
        SET idx_i AS 1  
        WHILE idx_i < row_count - 1 DO  
            SET idx_j AS 1  
            WHILE idx_j < column_count - 1 DO  
                IF is_magic(idx_i, idx_j) THEN  
                    total_count ← total_count + 1  
                END IF  
                idx_j ← idx_j + 1  
            END WHILE  
            idx_i ← idx_i + 1  
        END WHILE  

        RETURN total_count  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION shortestPathLength(graph)
        IF NOT (graph == empty collection) THEN
            SET nodeCount AS LENGTH OF graph
            SET dequeContainer AS new double-ended queue
            SET index AS zero
            WHILE index LESS THAN nodeCount
                SET item AS pair(index, ONE SHIFTED LEFT BY index)
                APPEND item TO dequeContainer
                INCREMENT index BY one
            END WHILE

            SET visitedStates AS new set dequeContainer

            SET distance AS zero
            SET fullMask AS (ONE SHIFTED LEFT BY nodeCount) MINUS one

            WHILE NOT (dequeContainer IS EMPTY)
                SET levelSize AS LENGTH OF dequeContainer
                SET stepCounter AS zero
                WHILE stepCounter LESS THAN levelSize
                    REMOVE leftmost element FROM dequeContainer INTO currentPair
                    SET currentNode AS currentPair's first element
                    SET visitedMask AS currentPair's second element

                    IF visitedMask == fullMask THEN
                        RETURN distance
                    END IF

                    FOR each adjacent IN graph AT index currentNode
                        SET updatedMask AS visitedMask OR (ONE SHIFTED LEFT BY adjacent)
                        SET nextPair AS pair(adjacent, updatedMask)

                        IF NOT (nextPair IN visitedStates) THEN
                            ADD nextPair TO visitedStates
                            APPEND nextPair TO dequeContainer
                        END IF
                    END FOR
                    INCREMENT stepCounter BY one
                END WHILE
                SET distance AS distance + 1
            END WHILE

            RETURN minus one
        ELSE
            RETURN zero
        END IF
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

        SET visited TO a new set containing the same pairs as in queue

        WHILE queue is not empty

            FOR iteration FROM one TO current_level_size  
                REMOVE the leftmost element from queue and DESCTRUCTURE INTO current_node and visited_nodes  
              
                IF visited_nodes EQUALS all_nodes_visited THEN  
                    RETURN steps  
                END IF

                    SET next_visited_nodes TO visited_nodes OR ONE SHIFTED LEFT BY neighbor  
                    SET next_state TO pair of neighbor and next_visited_nodes  
                  
                    IF next_state NOT IN visited THEN  
                        ADD next_state TO visited  
                        APPEND next_state TO queue  
                    END IF  
                END FOR  
            END FOR  
          
            INCREMENT steps BY one  
        END WHILE

CLASS Solution
	FUNCTION rectangleArea(rectangles)
		ASSIGN (10 ^ 9) PLUS 1 TO moduloLimit

		DECLARE verticalPositions AS empty associative array
		LOOP THROUGH rect IN rectangles:
			verticalPositions[rect[1]] = TRUE
			verticalPositions[rect[3]] = TRUE
		END LOOP

		CONVERT verticalPositions KEYS TO ARRAY AS sortedVerticals
		SORT sortedVerticals BY ASCENDING ORDER

		DECLARE lookupIndices AS empty map
		SET positionTracker TO 0
		WHILE positionTracker < LENGTH OF sortedVerticals
			lookupIndices[sortedVerticals[positionTracker]] = positionTracker
			SET positionTracker TO positionTracker + 1
		END WHILE

		DECLARE coverage AS ARRAY OF LENGTH LENGTH OF sortedVerticals FILLED WITH 0
		DECLARE lineEvents AS empty array

		SET pointer TO 0
		while pointer < LENGTH OF rectangles:
			ASSIGN rectangles[pointer][0], rectangles[pointer][1], rectangles[pointer][2], rectangles[pointer][3] TO a, b, c, d
			APPEND (a, 1, b, d) TO lineEvents
			APPEND (c, -1, b, d) TO lineEvents
			SET pointer TO pointer + 1
		END WHILE

		SORT lineEvents ACCORDING TO EVENT[0] IN ASCENDING ORDER

		SET priorX TO 0
		ASSIGN 0 TO totalArea

		DECLARE eventCounter TO 0
		WHILE eventCounter < LENGTH OF lineEvents:
			ASSIGN lineEvents[eventCounter] TO currX, evtType, ypos1, ypos2

			ASSIGN 0 TO cumLength
			DECLARE idx TO 1
			WHILE idx < LENGTH OF coverage
				IF coverage[idx - 1] > 0 THEN
					ASSIGN sortedVerticals[idx] - sortedVerticals[idx - 1] TO segmentLength
					ASSIGN cumLength + segmentLength TO cumLength
				END IF
				SET idx TO idx + 1
			END WHILE

			ASSIGN totalArea + cumLength * (currX - priorX) TO totalArea
			ASSIGN totalArea MOD moduloLimit TO totalArea

			ASSIGN lookupIndices[ypos1] TO startPos
			ASSIGN lookupIndices[ypos2] TO endPos
			ASSIGN startPos TO modifyIdx

			WHILE modifyIdx < endPos
				IF evtType EQUALS 1 THEN
					coverage[modifyIdx] = coverage[modifyIdx] + 1
				ELSE
					coverage[modifyIdx] = coverage[modifyIdx] - 1
				END IF
				SET modifyIdx TO modifyIdx + 1
			END WHILE

			SET priorX TO currX
			SET eventCounter TO eventCounter + 1
		END WHILE

		YIELD totalArea
	END FUNCTION
END CLASS

    FUNCTION carFleet(target, position, speed)

        SET idx TO 0  
        WHILE idx LESS THAN LENGTH OF position  
            APPEND (position[idx], speed[idx]) TO combinedPairs

            INCREMENT pairIndex BY 1

        SET timeIdx TO 0

            LET currentTime BE arrivalTimes[timeIdx]

                SET maxObservedTime TO currentTime  
                SET fleetCount TO fleetCount PLUS 1  
            END IF  
            INCREMENT timeIdx BY 1  
        END WHILE  

        RETURN fleetCount  
    END FUNCTION

        FUNCTION count_up_to_limit(limit)

                    ELSE

                    END IF  
                UNTIL FALSE  
                pos <- pos + 1  
            END WHILE  
            
            RETURN acc  
        END FUNCTION

    END FUNCTION

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION leastOpsExpressTarget(x, target)
        FUNCTION dp(target_inner)
            IF NOT (target_inner ≠ 0) THEN
                RETURN -1
            END IF

            IF target_inner >= x THEN
                INTEGER exponent_tracker ← 1
                WHILE POWER(x, exponent_tracker) ≤ target_inner DO
                    exponent_tracker ← exponent_tracker + 1
                END WHILE
                exponent_tracker ← exponent_tracker - 1

                INTEGER intermediate_value ← dp(target_inner - POWER(x, exponent_tracker)) + exponent_tracker

                INTEGER candidate ← POWER(x, exponent_tracker + 1) - target_inner
                IF candidate < target_inner THEN
                    INTEGER alternate_value ← dp(candidate) + exponent_tracker + 1
                    intermediate_value ← (intermediate_value < alternate_value) ? intermediate_value : alternate_value
                END IF

                RETURN intermediate_value
            ELSE
                INTEGER left_option ← 2 * target_inner - 1
                INTEGER right_option ← 2 * (x - target_inner)
                RETURN (left_option < right_option) ? left_option : right_option
            END IF
        END FUNCTION

        RETURN dp(target)
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution  
    FUNCTION isRationalEqual WITH PARAMETER s OF TYPE string WITH PARAMETER t OF TYPE string RETURNS boolean  
        SET fractions AS [1, 1/9, 1/99, 1/999, 1/9999]  

        FUNCTION valueOf WITH PARAMETER s OF TYPE string RETURNS a floating point number  
            SET openPos TO INDEX_OF('(' IN s)  
            IF openPos IS NOT_EQUAL_TO -1 THEN  
                SET closePos TO INDEX_OF(')' IN s)  
                SET decimalPos TO INDEX_OF('.' IN s)  
                SET baseValue TO TO_FLOAT(SUBSTRING(s, 0, openPos))  
                SET nonRepeatCount TO openPos - decimalPos - 1  
                SET repeatValue TO TO_INT(SUBSTRING(s, openPos + 1, closePos))  
                SET repeatLength TO closePos - openPos - 1  

                SET part1 TO repeatValue * fractions[repeatLength]  
                SET part2 TO part1 / (10 ^ nonRepeatCount)  
                RETURN baseValue + part2  
            END IF  
            RETURN TO_FLOAT(s)  
        END FUNCTION  

        SET diff TO ABS(valueOf(s) - valueOf(t))  
        RETURN diff < (1 / (10 ^ 9))  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION sortItems(n, m, group, beforeItems)
        SET next_group_id TO m
        SET idx TO 0
        WHILE idx LESS THAN n
            IF group[idx] EQUALS -1
                ASSIGN next_group_id TO group[idx]
                INCREMENT next_group_id
            END IF
            INCREMENT idx
        END WHILE

        ASSIGN group_contents TO empty dictionary mapping keys to empty lists
        ASSIGN adjacency_per_group TO empty dictionary mapping keys to empty lists
        ASSIGN adjacency_per_item TO empty dictionary mapping keys to empty lists
        ASSIGN in_degree_per_item TO list of zeros repeated n times
        ASSIGN in_degree_per_group TO list of zeros repeated next_group_id times

        ASSIGN index_var TO 0
        WHILE index_var LESS THAN n
            APPEND index_var TO group_contents[group[index_var]]
            INCREMENT index_var
        END WHILE

        SET outer_index TO 0
        WHILE outer_index LESS THAN n
            SET inner_index TO 0
            SET current_dependencies TO beforeItems[outer_index]
            WHILE inner_index LESS THAN LENGTH OF current_dependencies
                SET dependency TO current_dependencies[inner_index]
                IF NOT (group[dependency] DIFFERENT FROM group[outer_index])
                    APPEND outer_index TO adjacency_per_item[dependency]
                    in_degree_per_item[outer_index] = in_degree_per_item[outer_index] + 1
                ELSE
                    APPEND group[outer_index] TO adjacency_per_group[group[dependency]]
                    in_degree_per_group[group[outer_index]] = in_degree_per_group[group[outer_index]] + 1
                END IF
                INCREMENT inner_index
            END WHILE
            INCREMENT outer_index
        END WHILE

        FUNCTION topological_sort(graph, in_degree, items)
            ASSIGN processing_queue TO empty double-ended queue
            ASSIGN collected_result TO empty list

            FOR each element IN items
                IF in_degree[element] EQUALS 0
                    APPEND element TO processing_queue
                END IF
            END FOR

            WHILE LENGTH OF processing_queue GREATER THAN 0
                REMOVE front OF processing_queue AND STORE IN current_node
                APPEND current_node TO collected_result
                ASSIGN neighbors TO graph[current_node]
                ASSIGN neighbor_counter TO 0
                WHILE neighbor_counter LESS THAN LENGTH OF neighbors
                    SET neighbor TO neighbors[neighbor_counter]
                    DECREMENT in_degree[neighbor] BY 1
                    IF in_degree[neighbor] EQUALS 0
                        APPEND neighbor TO processing_queue
                    END IF
                    INCREMENT neighbor_counter
                END WHILE
            END WHILE

            IF LENGTH OF collected_result EQUALS LENGTH OF items
                RETURN collected_result
            ELSE
                RETURN empty list
            END IF
        END FUNCTION

        ASSIGN global_sorted_items TO empty list
        FOR EACH group_key IN group_contents KEYS
            ASSIGN sorted_sequence TO topological_sort(adjacency_per_item, in_degree_per_item, group_contents[group_key])
            IF LENGTH OF sorted_sequence EQUALS 0
                RETURN empty list
            END IF
            FOR each element IN sorted_sequence
                APPEND element TO global_sorted_items
            END FOR
        END FOR

        ASSIGN sorted_group_order TO topological_sort(adjacency_per_group, in_degree_per_group, LIST OF INTEGERS FROM 0 TO next_group_id MINUS 1)
        IF LENGTH OF sorted_group_order EQUALS 0
            RETURN empty list
        END IF

        ASSIGN ordered_items_per_group TO empty dictionary mapping keys to empty lists
        FOR EACH sorted_item IN global_sorted_items
            APPEND sorted_item TO ordered_items_per_group[group[sorted_item]]
        END FOR

        ASSIGN final_sorted_list TO empty list
        FOR EACH group_in_order IN sorted_group_order
            CONCATENATE ordered_items_per_group[group_in_order] TO final_sorted_list
        END FOR

        RETURN final_sorted_list
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

                    APPEND i TO list at key before_element in item_graph  
                    INCREMENT element at position i of item_in_degree BY one  
                ELSE  
                    APPEND element at position i of group TO list at key element at position before_element of group in group_graph  
                    INCREMENT element at position element at position i of group of group_in_degree BY one  
                END IF  
            END FOR  
        END FOR  
        
        FUNCTION topological_sort(graph, in_degree, items)  
            SET queue TO a double-ended queue initialized with elements from items WHERE element at position element of in_degree EQUALS zero  
            SET result TO empty list  
            
            WHILE queue is not empty  
                REMOVE element from front of queue and assign to u  
                APPEND u TO result

                    IF element at position v of in_degree EQUALS zero  
                        APPEND v TO queue  
                    END IF  
                END FOR

            ELSE  
                RETURN empty list  
            END IF  
        END FUNCTION

                RETURN empty list  
            END IF  
            EXTEND sorted_within_groups BY sorted_items

        FOR each grp IN sorted_groups  
            EXTEND result BY list at key grp in group_to_items_map  
        END FOR

    END FUNCTION

    FUNCTION countVowelPermutation(n)
        DEFINE DIVISOR AS 1_000_000_007
        INITIALIZE alpha AS 1
        INITIALIZE beta AS 1
        INITIALIZE gamma AS 1
        INITIALIZE delta AS 1
        INITIALIZE epsilon AS 1

        SET counter TO 2

            DEFINE next_beta AS alpha + gamma
            DEFINE next_gamma AS beta + delta
            DEFINE next_delta AS gamma

            gamma ← next_gamma MODULO DIVISOR
            delta ← next_delta MODULO DIVISOR
            epsilon ← next_epsilon MODULO DIVISOR

            INCREMENT counter BY 1
        END WHILE

        COMPUTE aggregate_total = alpha + beta + gamma + delta + epsilon
        ASSIGN final_result AS aggregate_total MODULO DIVISOR
        RETURN final_result
    END FUNCTION

            SET possible_gain TO the ABSOLUTE VALUE OF element at position zero of nums MINUS element at position i of nums MINUS the ABSOLUTE VALUE OF element at position i of nums MINUS element at position i MINUS one of nums  
            IF possible_gain GREATER THAN max_edge_gain  
                SET max_edge_gain TO possible_gain  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        
        FOR i FROM zero TO n MINUS two  
            SET possible_gain TO the ABSOLUTE VALUE OF element at position n MINUS one of nums MINUS element at position i of nums MINUS the ABSOLUTE VALUE OF element at position i PLUS one of nums MINUS element at position i of nums  
            IF possible_gain GREATER THAN max_edge_gain  
                SET max_edge_gain TO possible_gain  
            END IF  
        END FOR  
        
        SET min_pair TO the MINIMUM VALUE among for each i FROM zero TO n MINUS two the MAXIMUM VALUE between element at position i of nums AND element at position i PLUS one of nums  
        SET max_pair TO the MAXIMUM VALUE among for each i FROM zero TO n MINUS two the MINIMUM VALUE between element at position i of nums AND element at position i PLUS one of nums  
        
        SET general_gain TO the MAXIMUM VALUE between zero AND two MULTIPLIED BY the DIFFERENCE between max_pair AND min_pair  
        
        RETURN initial_value PLUS the MAXIMUM VALUE between max_edge_gain AND general_gain

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION cherryPickup(grid)
        SET totalRows AS LENGTH(grid)
        SET totalCols AS LENGTH(grid[0])
        
        FUNCTION dp(r c1 c2)
            IF (c1 < 0) OR (c1 >= totalCols) OR (c2 < 0) OR (c2 >= totalCols) THEN
                RETURN 0
            END IF

            IF c1 = c2 THEN
                SET gathered AS grid[r][c1]
            ELSE
                SET gathered AS grid[r][c1] + grid[r][c2]
            END IF

            IF r = totalRows - 1 THEN
                RETURN gathered
            END IF
            
            SET supremeValue TO 0
            SET deltaIndexOneList TO [-1 0 1]
            SET deltaIndexTwoList TO [-1 0 1]
            SET outerCounter TO 0
            WHILE outerCounter < LENGTH(deltaIndexOneList)
                SET innerCounter TO 0
                WHILE innerCounter < LENGTH(deltaIndexTwoList)
                    SET candidateSum TO dp(r + 1 c1 + deltaIndexOneList[outerCounter] c2 + deltaIndexTwoList[innerCounter])
                    IF candidateSum > supremeValue THEN
                        supremeValue ← candidateSum
                    END IF
                    innerCounter ← innerCounter + 1
                END WHILE
                outerCounter ← outerCounter + 1
            END WHILE

            RETURN gathered + supremeValue
        END FUNCTION

        RETURN dp(0 0 totalCols - 1)
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION minNumberOfSemesters(n k relations)
        INITIALIZE graph AS a mapping with default empty list for unseen keys
        INITIALIZE in_degree AS a list containing (n + 1) zeros
        
        SET edgeIndex TO 0
        WHILE edgeIndex < LENGTH(relations)
            SET fromNode TO relations[edgeIndex][0]
            SET toNode TO relations[edgeIndex][1]
            ADD toNode TO graph[fromNode]
            SET in_degree[toNode] TO in_degree[toNode] + 1
            INCREMENT edgeIndex BY 1
        END WHILE
        
        INITIALIZE pendingCourses AS empty deque
        SET courseID TO 1
        LOOP
            IF courseID > n THEN BREAK
            IF in_degree[courseID] = 0 THEN
                APPEND courseID TO pendingCourses
            END IF
            INCREMENT courseID BY 1
        END LOOP
        
        SET semesterCount TO 0
        
        WHILE LENGTH(pendingCourses) > 0
            SET maxCoursesThisRound TO k
            IF maxCoursesThisRound > LENGTH(pendingCourses) THEN
                SET maxCoursesThisRound TO LENGTH(pendingCourses)
            END IF
            
            SET counter TO 0
            RECURSIVE_PROCESS:
                IF counter >= maxCoursesThisRound THEN
                    GOTO FINISH_PROCESS
                END IF
                
                SET currentCourse TO REMOVE_LEFT(pendingCourses)
                FOR every adjacentCourse IN graph[currentCourse]
                    SET in_degree[adjacentCourse] TO in_degree[adjacentCourse] - 1
                    IF in_degree[adjacentCourse] = 0 THEN
                        APPEND adjacentCourse TO pendingCourses
                    END IF
                END FOR
                
                SET counter TO counter + 1
                GOTO RECURSIVE_PROCESS
            FINISH_PROCESS:
            
            SET semesterCount TO semesterCount + 1
        END WHILE
        
        RETURN semesterCount
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

            APPEND nextCourse TO the list associated with prevCourse in graph  
            INCREMENT the element at position nextCourse of in_degree BY one  
        END FOR  
        
        SET queue TO an empty double-ended queue  
        FOR course FROM one TO n  
            IF the element at position course of in_degree EQUALS zero  
                APPEND course TO queue  
            END IF  
        END FOR

        WHILE queue holds any elements

                REMOVE the element from the left end of queue AND ASSIGN to current_course

                    DECREMENT the element at position next_course of in_degree BY one  
                    IF the element at position next_course of in_degree EQUALS zero  
                        APPEND next_course TO queue  
                    END IF  
                END FOR  
            END FOR  
            INCREMENT semesters BY one  
        END WHILE  
        
        RETURN semesters  
    END FUNCTION  
END CLASS

CLASS Solution
    FUNCTION getMinDistSum(positions)
        LET totalPoints ← LENGTH OF positions
        LET centerX ← 0
        LET centerY ← 0
        FOR each coord IN positions DO
            LET px ← coord[0]
            LET py ← coord[1]
            centerX ← centerX + px
            centerY ← centerY + py
        END FOR
        centerX ← centerX / totalPoints
        centerY ← centerY / totalPoints

        LET shrinkFactor ← 0.999
        LET threshold ← 0.000001
        LET rate ← 0.5

        REPEAT
            LET gradientX ← 0
            LET gradientY ← 0
            LET totalDistance ← 0
            FOR each coord IN positions DO
                LET xVal ← coord[0]
                LET yVal ← coord[1]
                LET diffX ← centerX - xVal
                LET diffY ← centerY - yVal
                LET distVal ← SQRT(diffX * diffX + diffY * diffY)
                gradientX ← gradientX + (diffX / distVal + 0.00000001)
                gradientY ← gradientY + (diffY / distVal + 0.00000001)
                totalDistance ← totalDistance + distVal
            END FOR

            LET stepX ← gradientX * rate
            LET stepY ← gradientY * rate

            centerX ← centerX - stepX
            centerY ← centerY - stepY

            rate ← rate * shrinkFactor

            IF (ABS(stepX) ≤ threshold) AND (ABS(stepY) ≤ threshold) THEN
                RETURN totalDistance
            END IF
        UNTIL FALSE
    END FUNCTION
END CLASS

    FUNCTION getMinDistSum(positions)

        SET y TO zero
